remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，可以使用此方法以关闭套接字。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you can use this method to close the socket. 此方法结束连接和集属性设置为`false`。This method ends the connection and sets the property to `false`. 但是，如果`reuseSocket`是`true`，可以重复使用套接字。However, if `reuseSocket` is `true`, you can reuse the socket. 若要确保发送和接收套接字关闭之前的所有数据，应调用之前调用方法。To ensure that all data is sent and received before the socket is closed, you should call before calling the method. 如果您需要调用没有首先调用，可以设置选项设为`false`而指定的非零的超时间隔，以确保排队等待发送传出的传输的数据。If you need to call without first calling , you can set the option to `false` and specify a nonzero time-out interval to ensure that data queued for outgoing transmission is sent. 然后阻止，直到发送数据或直到指定的超时时间已到。 then blocks until the data is sent or until the specified time-out expires. 如果您设置到`false`并指定为零的超时间隔、释放连接，并会自动放弃传出队列的数据。If you set to `false` and specify a zero time-out interval, releases the connection and automatically discards outgoing queued data. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建同步通信套接字，并将一些数据发送到远程主机。The following code example creates a socket for synchronous communication and sends some data to a remote host. 然后，它调用，以停止发送和接收活动，并以关闭套接字连接。It then calls , to stop the send and receive activity, and , to close the socket connection. [!code-cpp[Nclsocketenhancements#12](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLSocketEnhancements/CPP/nclsocketenhancements.cpp#12)] [!code-csharp[Nclsocketenhancements#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLSocketEnhancements/CS/nclsocketenhancements.cs#12)]

summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例所使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 在调用`Dispose`，必须释放对所有引用这样垃圾回收器才能收回内存的占用。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)并[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共`Dispose()`方法和方法。This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the method. `Dispose()` 调用受保护`Dispose(Boolean)`方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用`Dispose`与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose()` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

summary.span: 获取或设置 值，该值指定 是否允许将 Internet 协议 (IP) 数据报分段。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the allows Internet Protocol (IP) datagrams to be fragmented.

value.span: 如果 允许数据报分段，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the allows datagram fragmentation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 其大小超过最大传输单元 (MTU) 的传输媒体时，数据报要求碎片。Datagrams require fragmentation when their size exceeds the Maximum Transfer Unit (MTU) of the transmission medium. 数据报可能通过发送主机 （所有 Internet 协议版本） 或中间路由器 (Internet 协议版本 4 仅) 分段。Datagrams may be fragmented by the sending host (all Internet Protocol versions) or an intermediate router (Internet Protocol Version 4 only). 如果必须碎片数据报，和选项设置、 数据报将被放弃，并且 Internet 控制消息协议 (ICMP) 错误消息发送回发送方的数据报。If a datagram must be fragmented, and the option is set, the datagram is discarded, and an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message is sent back to the sender of the datagram. 传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字上设置此属性不会影响。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 目标进程应使用创建重复套接字实例。The target process should use to create the duplicate socket instance. 如果您调用多次使用相同的字节数组，作为每个调用的参数的构造函数，您将创建多个托管具有相同的基础套接字的实例。If you call the constructor multiple times with the same byte array as the argument for each call, you will create multiple managed instances with the same underlying socket. 这种做法是强烈建议不要使用。This practice is strongly discouraged. 如果进程创建套接字使用的异步方法 (或)，该过程必须首先设置属性设置为 true; 否则为套接字绑定到完成端口的创建过程中，这可能会导致目标进程中抛出。If the process creating the socket uses asynchronous methods ( or ), the process must first set the property to true; otherwise, the socket is bound to the completion port of the creating process, which may cause an to be thrown on the target process.

span.span: is not a valid process id.
-or-

exception.span: 套接字引用的复制失败。

span.span: Duplication of the socket reference failed.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个 值，该值指定 是否可以发送或接收广播数据包。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the can send or receive broadcast packets.

value.span: 如果 允许广播数据包，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the allows broadcast packets; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 广播仅限于特定的子网，并且必须使用用户数据报协议 (UDP)。有关 Internet 协议版本 4，您可以通过将数据包发送到 255.255.255.255; 广播本地子网或者，可以使用定向广播的地址，这是使用中的主机部分设置的所有位的 Internet 协议 (IP) 地址的网络部分。Broadcasting is limited to a specific subnet, and must use User Datagram Protocol (UDP.) For Internet Protocol version 4, you can broadcast to your local subnet by sending a packet to 255.255.255.255; or you can use the directed broadcast address, which is the network portion of an Internet Protocol (IP) address with all bits set in the host portion. 例如，如果你的 IP 地址为 192.168.1.40 （C 类地址，网络掩码为 255.255.255.0-网络部分是前三个八位字节，而主机部分是最后一个八进制数），则定向广播的地址是 192.168.1.255。For example, if your IP address is 192.168.1.40 (a Class C address, with a netmask of 255.255.255.0 -- the network portion is the first three octets, and the host portion is the last octet), your directed broadcast address is 192.168.1.255. 传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字上设置此属性不会影响。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对调用。 completes a call to . 然后再调用，你需要创建一个回调方法，它通过调用委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that is invoked by the delegate. 该回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行并由系统后调用方法返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread, and is called by the system after the method returns. 在回调方法中，调用方法`asyncResult`参数来获取上可由连接尝试。Within the callback method, call the method of the `asyncResult` parameter to obtain the on which the connection attempt is being made. 获取后，可以调用方法才能成功完成连接尝试。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the connection attempt. `buffer`的此重载的参数包含对的调用中收到的数据和`bytesTransferred`参数包含已传输的调用中的字节数。The `buffer` parameter of this overload contains the data that was received in the call to and the `bytesTransferred` parameter contains the number of bytes that were transferred in the call. 方法进行阻止，直到挂起的连接，传入的连接队列中。The method blocks until a connection is pending in the incoming connection queue. 方法接受传入连接，并返回一个新可用来将数据发送到和从远程主机接收数据。The method accepts the incoming connection and returns a new that can be used to send data to and receive data from the remote host. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用可创建和连接套接字接受前 10 个字节的数据。The following code example uses to create and connect a socket and accept the initial 10 bytes of data. 回调委托调用结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 在返回传输的字节数和数据`buffer`和`bytesTransferred`此方法的参数并在控制台上显示。The number of bytes transmitted and the data are returned in the `buffer` and `bytesTransferred` parameters of this method and are displayed on the console. remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对调用。 completes a call to . 然后再调用，你需要创建一个回调方法，它通过调用委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that is invoked by the delegate. 该回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行并由系统后调用方法返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread, and is called by the system after the method returns. 必须接受`asyncResult`参数从返回方法。It must accept the `asyncResult` parameter returned from the method. 在回调方法中，调用方法`asyncResult`参数来获取上可由连接尝试。Within the callback method, call the method of the `asyncResult` parameter to obtain the on which the connection attempt is being made. 获取后，可以调用方法才能成功完成连接尝试。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the connection attempt. `buffer`的此重载的参数包含对的调用中收到的数据和`bytesTransferred`参数包含已传输的调用中的字节数。The `buffer` parameter of this overload contains the data that was received in the call to and the `bytesTransferred` parameter contains the number of bytes that were transferred in the call. 方法进行阻止，直到挂起的连接，传入的连接队列中。The method blocks until a connection is pending in the incoming connection queue. 方法接受传入连接，并返回一个新可用来将数据发送到和从远程主机接收数据。The method accepts the incoming connection and returns a new that can be used to send data to and receive data from the remote host. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用可创建和连接套接字接受前 10 个字节的数据。The following code example uses to create and connect a socket and accept the initial 10 bytes of data. 回调委托调用结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 在返回传输的字节数和数据`buffer`和`bytesTransferred`此方法的参数并在控制台上显示。The number of bytes transmitted and the data are returned in the `buffer` and `bytesTransferred` parameters of this method and are displayed on the console. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在中启动阻止方法，在完成异步远程主机连接请求方法。 is a blocking method that completes the asynchronous remote host connection request started in the method. 然后再调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 该回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行，并由系统后调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回的方法作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法参数来获取上可由连接尝试。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the on which the connection attempt is being made. 获取后，可以调用方法才能成功完成连接尝试。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the connection attempt. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束异步连接尝试。The following code example ends the asynchronous connection attempt. 有关演示如何使用套接字的异步通信的完整示例，请参阅[套接字代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对调用。 completes a call to . 方法进行阻止，直到完成断开连接。The method blocks until the disconnect completes. 有关异步操作的信息，请参阅 MSDN library 中的异步编程的概述主题。For information about asynchronous operations, see the Asynchronous Programming Overview topic in the MSDN library. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建的套接字进行异步通信，并将一些数据发送到远程主机。The following code example creates a socket for asynchronous communication and sends some data to a remote host. 已发送数据，调用来停止发送和接收活动。When the data has been sent, is called to stop the send and receive activity. 然后调用以开始断开连接请求。Then is called to begin a disconnect request. 回调委托调用结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 完成请求后，属性进行查询，以测试是否已断开连接的套接字。When the request completes, the property is queried to test whether the socket is disconnected. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成异步读取的操作以启动方法。The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 然后再调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 该回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行，并由系统后调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回的方法作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法若要获取状态对象传递给方法。Within the callback method, call the method of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 提取接收从该状态对象。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取后，可以调用方法成功完成读取的操作，并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 方法将阻塞，直到有可用数据。The method will block until data is available. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，将读取传入的网络缓冲区中有可用的第一个排队数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will read the first enqueued datagram available in the incoming network buffer. 如果使用面向连接的协议方法将读取的数据，可在指定的字节数目可高达`size`参数的方法。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method will read as much data as is available up to the number of bytes you specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 若要获取所接收的数据，请调用方法的，然后提取生成的状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the method of the , and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. 若要取消挂起，调用方法。To cancel a pending , call the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 由给定线程启动的所有 i/o 操作被取消时该线程退出。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果在线程退出该操作完成之前，挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步读取。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous read. 有关演示如何使用套接字的异步通信的完整示例，请参阅[套接字代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成异步发送操作中启动。 completes the asynchronous send operation started in . 然后再调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 该回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行，并由系统后调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回的方法作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法参数来获取发送。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the sending . 获取后，可以调用方法成功完成发送操作并返回发送的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the send operation and return the number of bytes sent. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，会阻塞，直到发送数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will block until the datagram is sent. 如果使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到某些缓冲区已发送。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until some of the buffer was sent. 如果的返回值指示的缓冲区不是完全发送，调用方法同样，修改要保存的未发送的数据的缓冲区。If the return value from indicates that the buffer was not completely sent, call the method again, modifying the buffer to hold the unsent data. 则您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 由给定线程启动的所有 i/o 操作被取消时该线程退出。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果在线程退出该操作完成之前，挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 发送的成功完成并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果任何缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据在传输系统中不不可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步发送。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous send. [!code-cpp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#6)] [!code-vb[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果是`false`，可以使用多个套接字方法绑定到特定端口; 但是只有一个套接字可以执行对发送到端口的网络流量的操作。If is `false`, multiple sockets can use the method to bind to a specific port; however only one of the sockets can perform operations on the network traffic sent to the port. 如果尝试使用多个套接字方法绑定到特殊端口时，则使用更具体的 IP 地址之一将处理发送到该端口的网络流量。If more than one socket attempts to use the method to bind to a particular port, then the one with the more specific IP address will handle the network traffic sent to that port. 如果是`true`，首次使用方法来尝试绑定到特定端口，而不考虑 Internet 协议 (IP) 地址，将会成功; 的所有后续使用方法来尝试绑定到该端口将失败，直到销毁原始绑定套接字。If is `true`, the first use of the method to attempt to bind to a particular port, regardless of Internet Protocol (IP) address, will succeed; all subsequent uses of the method to attempt to bind to that port will fail until the original bound socket is destroyed. 此属性必须设置前被调用; 否则为将引发。This property must be set before is called; otherwise an will be thrown. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个套接字被视为绑定到本地端口，如果它显式绑定通过调用方法，或通过调用成员，例如隐式绑定， ，或，它使用临时的本地端口 （了可用端口大于1024，由操作系统选择。)服务器使用方法，以便客户端可能会连接到其绑定到的已知端口。A socket is considered bound to a local port if it is explicitly bound by calling the method, or implicitly bound by calling members like , , or , which use an ephemeral local port (a free port greater than 1024, selected by the operating system.) Servers use the method to bind to a well-known port so that clients may connect to them. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指定 在尝试发送所有挂起数据时是否延迟关闭套接字。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the will delay closing a socket in an attempt to send all pending data.

value.span: 一个 ，它指定关闭套接字时如何逗留。

span.span: A that specifies how to linger while closing a socket.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性更改的方式方法的行为。The property changes the way method behaves. 当集修改的条件下的连接可以重置通过 Winsock 时此属性。This property when set modifies the conditions under which the connection can be reset by Winsock. 连接重置仍会发生基于 IP 协议行为。Connection resets can still occur based on the IP protocol behavior. 此属性控制的面向连接的连接是在调用后仍保持打开的时间长度仍然要发送数据时。This property controls the length of time that a connection-oriented connection will remain open after a call to when data remains to be sent. 当调用方法以将数据发送到对等方时，此数据位于传出的网络缓冲区中。When you call methods to send data to a peer, this data is placed in the outgoing network buffer. 此属性可以用于确保此数据发送到远程主机之前方法用于删除连接。This property can be used to ensure that this data is sent to the remote host before the method drops the connection. 若要启用延迟，创建实例包含所需的值，并设置指向此实例的属性。To enable lingering, create a instance containing the desired values, and set the property to this instance. 下表描述的行为的可能值的方法属性和属性存储在属性。The following table describes the behavior of the method for the possible values of the property and the property stored in the property. |LingerState.EnabledLingerState.Enabled|LingerState.LingerTimeLingerState.LingerTime|行为Behavior| |-------------------------|----------------------------|--------------| |`false` （禁用），默认值`false` (disabled), the default value|不适用，超时值 （默认值）。The time-out is not applicable, (default).|尝试发送挂起的数据，直到默认 IP 协议超时时间已到。Attempts to send pending data until the default IP protocol time-out expires.| |`true` （已启用）`true` (enabled)|非零值超时A nonzero time-out|尝试发送挂起的数据，直到指定的超时时间已到，如果该尝试失败，然后 Winsock 重置连接。Attempts to send pending data until the specified time-out expires, and if the attempt fails, then Winsock resets the connection.| |`true` （已启用）`true` (enabled)|零个超时时间。A zero timeout.|将放弃所有挂起的数据。Discards any pending data. 对于面向连接的套接字 (例如 TCP)，Winsock 重置连接。For connection-oriented socket (TCP, for example), Winsock resets the connection.| IP 堆栈计算默认 IP 协议的超时期限为使用基于连接的往返行程时间。The IP stack computes the default IP protocol time-out period to use based on the round trip time of the connection. 在大多数情况下，计算堆栈的超时值是个应用程序定义的更多相关。In most cases, the time-out computed by the stack is more relevant than one defined by an application. 这是一个套接字的默认行为时未设置属性。This is the default behavior for a socket when the property is not set. 当属性存储在属性设置为大于默认 IP 协议超时时间，则默认 IP 协议超时时间仍将应用，并替代。When the property stored in the property is set greater than the default IP protocol time-out, the default IP protocol time-out will still apply and override. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. span.span: if the receives outgoing multicast packets; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多播是在 Internet 上的多对多通信的可缩放方法。Multicast is a scalable method for many-to-many communication on the Internet. 处理订阅的多播地址;然后，可由其他每个订阅的多播地址的过程接收已订阅进程发送任何数据包。A process subscribes to a multicast address; then, any packets sent by a subscribed process are received by every other process subscribed to the multicast address. 传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字上设置此属性不会影响。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. summary.span: 获取或设置 值，该值指定流 是否正在使用 Nagle 算法。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the stream is using the Nagle algorithm.

value.span: 如果 使用 Nagle 算法，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the uses the Nagle algorithm; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Nagle 算法设计为套接字缓冲小数据包，然后组合并在某些情况下一个数据包中发送，从而减少网络流量。The Nagle algorithm is designed to reduce network traffic by causing the socket to buffer small packets and then combine and send them in one packet under certain circumstances. TCP 数据包包含 40 个字节的标头以及发送的数据。A TCP packet consists of 40 bytes of header plus the data being sent. 与 TCP 发送的数据的小数据包，从而从 TCP 标头的开销会变为网络流量的重要组成部分。在负载较重的网络上导致这种开销的拥塞可能会导致丢失的数据报和重传现象，以及由阻塞导致过多的传播时间。When small packets of data are sent with TCP, the overhead resulting from the TCP header can become a significant part of the network traffic.On heavily loaded networks, the congestion resulting from this overhead can result in lost datagrams and retransmissions, as well as excessive propagation time caused by congestion. Nagle 算法禁止发送的新 TCP segmentswhen 新传出数据到达从用户中，如果在连接上的任何处数据仍未确认。The Nagle algorithm inhibits the sending of new TCP segmentswhen new outgoing data arrives from the user if any previouslytransmitted data on the connection remains unacknowledged. 大多数网络应用程序应使用 Nagle 算法。The majority of network applications should use the Nagle algorithm. 用户数据报协议 (UDP) 套接字上设置此属性不会影响。Setting this property on a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将检查的状态。The method will check the state of the . 指定有关`selectMode`参数，以确定如果是可读。Specify for the `selectMode` parameter to determine if the is readable. 指定来确定如果是可写。Specify to determine if the is writable. 使用检测错误条件。Use to detect an error condition. 将阻止执行，直到指定的时间段，以测量`microseconds`，结束。 will block execution until the specified time period, measured in `microseconds`, elapses. 设置`microSeconds`参数为负的整数，如果你想要无限期地等待响应。Set the `microSeconds` parameter to a negative integer if you would like to wait indefinitely for a response. 如果你想要检查的多个套接字的状态，您可能更倾向于使用方法。If you want to check the status of multiple sockets, you might prefer to use the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 此方法无法检测到某些类型的连接问题，例如断开的网络电缆，或远程主机意外关闭。This method cannot detect certain kinds of connection problems, such as a broken network cable, or that the remote host was shut down ungracefully. 您必须尝试发送或接收数据，以检测这些类型的错误。You must attempt to send or receive data to detect these kinds of errors. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个套接字，连接到服务器，并使用检查套接字的状态。The following code example creates a socket, connects to a server, and uses to check the status of the socket. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入缓冲区参数并返回已成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 您可以调用从面向连接的和无连接套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载仅要求您提供接收缓冲区。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer. 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，默认大小为缓冲区参数的长度并默认值为。The buffer offset defaults to 0, the size defaults to the length of the buffer parameter, and the value defaults to . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，必须调用建立的远程主机连接，或以接受传入连接之前调用。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将只读取数据中建立的远程主机发送过来或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有任何数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到数据不可用，除非使用设置的超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果您是在非阻止模式下，并且没有在可用的数据中的协议堆栈缓冲区方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 可以使用属性来确定数据是否可供读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的，则方法将读取数量是可用，直到达到缓冲区的大小的数据。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果您使用的是无连接，会从在指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`参数，`buffer`进行填充与该消息的第一部分，过多的数据都将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将数据读入的缓冲区参数并返回已成功读取的字节数。This method reads data into the buffers parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 您可以调用从面向连接的和无连接套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载要求您提供一个或多个接收缓冲区。This overload requires you to provide one or more receive buffers. 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，必须调用建立的远程主机连接，或以接受传入连接之前调用。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将只读取来自中建立的远程主机连接的数据或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host connection established in the or method. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有任何数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到数据不可用，除非使用设置的超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果您是在非阻止模式下，并且没有在可用的数据中的协议堆栈缓冲区方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 可以使用属性来确定数据是否可供读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的，则方法将读取数量是可用，直到达到缓冲区的大小的数据。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果您使用的是无连接，会从在指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first enqueued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffers`参数，`buffers`进行填充与该消息的第一部分，过多的数据都将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffers` parameter, `buffers` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. **请注意**此成员时应用程序中启用网络跟踪输出跟踪信息。**Note** This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将数据读入`buffers`参数，并返回已成功读取的字节数。This method reads data into the `buffers` parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 您可以调用从面向连接的和无连接套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载要求您提供一个或多个接收缓冲区。This overload requires you to provide one or more receive buffers. 默认值为。The value defaults to . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，必须调用建立的远程主机连接，或以接受传入连接之前调用。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将只读取来自中建立的远程主机连接的数据或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host connection established in the or method. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有任何数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到数据不可用，除非使用设置的超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用，则会引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call throws a . 如果您是在非阻止模式下，并且没有在可用的数据中的协议堆栈缓冲区方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 可以使用属性来确定数据是否可供读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的，则方法将读取数量是可用，直到达到缓冲区的大小的数据。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果您使用的是无连接，会从在指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffers`参数，`buffers`进行填充与该消息的第一部分，过多的数据都将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffers` parameter, `buffers` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

returns.span: 在这种情况下，将不会引发 参数的 事件，并且可能在方法调用返回后立即检查作为参数传递的 对象以检索操作的结果。

span.span: In this case, The event on the parameter will not be raised and the object passed as a parameter may be examined immediately after the method call returns to retrieve the result of the operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用在套接字或绑定无连接的套接字连接，用于读取传入的数据。The method is used on connected sockets or bound connectionless sockets and is used to read incoming data. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 对于绑定无连接的套接字，此函数将限制从其接受已收到的消息的地址。For bound connectionless sockets, this function restricts the addresses from which received messages are accepted. 该函数仅返回从连接中指定的远程地址的消息。The function only returns messages from the remote address specified in the connection. 从其他地址的消息将以无提示方式被丢弃。Messages from other addresses are silently discarded. 属性上的`e`参数提供了关于读取请求的其他信息的窗口套接字服务提供程序。The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 下列属性和事件上的成功调用此方法所需的对象：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - 或 or - 如果设置 if is set - 如果设置 if is set - 调用方可能会设置属性设置为在调用之前所需的任何用户状态对象方法，以便可在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于字节流样式套接字，传入的数据被放入缓冲区中直到填充缓冲区，连接将关闭，或用完内部缓冲的数据。For byte stream-style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 对于面向消息的套接字传入的消息会放入缓冲区中直到与关联的缓冲区的总大小`e`参数。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer associated with the `e` parameter. 如果大于缓冲区消息，消息的第一个部分填充缓冲区。If the message is larger than the buffer, the buffer is filled with the first part of the message. 对于面向连接的套接字，方法可以指示依赖于套接字是字节流或面向消息的两种方式之一中的虚拟线路正常终止。For connection-oriented sockets, the method can indicate the graceful termination of the virtual circuit in one of two ways that depend on whether the socket is byte stream or message oriented. 对于字节流，已读零字节指示正常结束，并且将不会读取任何字节。For byte streams, zero bytes having been read indicates graceful closure and that no more bytes will ever be read. 对于面向消息的套接字，其中零字节的消息通常是允许的与设置为本机 Winsock WSAEDISCON 错误代码 (10101) 用于指示正常结束。For message-oriented sockets, where a zero byte message is often allowable, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAEDISCON error code (10101) is used to indicate graceful closure. 在任何情况下，与错误代码 (10054) 设置为本机 Winsock WSAECONNRESET 指示硬性关闭已发生。In any case, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAECONNRESET error code (10054) indicates an abortive close has occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 更大的缓冲区大小可能会减少了空确认 （不包含数据部分的 TCP 数据包），但也可能会延迟连接问题的识别。A larger buffer size potentially reduces the number of empty acknowledgements (TCP packets with no data portion), but might also delay the recognition of connection difficulties. 请考虑增加缓冲区大小，如果传输大型文件，或者使用的高带宽、 高延迟连接 （如机顶盒宽带提供商。）Consider increasing the buffer size if you are transferring large files, or you are using a high bandwidth, high latency connection (such as a satellite broadband provider.) ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数，返回已成功读取的字节数和捕获从其发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 此方法很有用，如果你想要从未知的主机或多个主机接收无连接的数据报。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 此重载仅要求您提供一个接收`buffer`，和一个表示远程主机。This overload only requires you to provide a receive `buffer`, and an that represents the remote host. 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0。The buffer offset defaults to 0. 大小默认值的长度`buffer`参数和`socketFlags`默认值为。The size defaults to the length of the `buffer` parameter and the `socketFlags` value defaults to . > [!NOTE] > 然后再调用，则必须显式将绑定到本地终结点使用方法。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 如果不，这样做将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 使用无连接协议时，将读取第一个排队数据报接收到的本地网络缓冲区。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`，则方法将填充`buffer`太多的是，且引发的消息与。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果使用的不可靠的协议，则多余的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果您使用的是可靠的协议，多余的数据将保留由服务提供商可以通过调用检索它方法使用一个足够大的缓冲区。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有任何数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到有可用数据。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果您是在非阻止模式下，并且没有在可用的数据中的协议堆栈缓冲区方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 可以使用属性来确定数据是否可供读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议，你可以使用面向连接的协议也。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果你选择这样做，则必须首先可以建立远程主机连接通过调用方法，或接受传入的远程主机连接，通过调用方法。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果没有建立或接受连接，然后调用方法时，将获取。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 您还可以建立默认远程主机之前调用的无连接协议方法。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这些情况下，任一方法将忽略`remoteEP`参数和仅接收来自连接的数据或默认远程主机。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 使用面向连接的套接字将读取的数据，可最大的大小`buffer`。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the size of `buffer`. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用必须与匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例从远程主机接收无连接的数据报。The following code example receives a connectionless datagram from a remote host. [!code-cpp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#9](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#9)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#9)] [!code-vb[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#9)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数，返回已成功读取的字节数和捕获从其发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 此方法很有用，如果你想要从未知的主机或多个主机接收无连接的数据报。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 使用无连接协议时，将读取第一个排队数据报接收到的本地网络缓冲区。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`，则方法将填充`buffer`太多的是，且引发的消息与。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果使用的不可靠的协议，则多余的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果您使用的是可靠的协议，多余的数据将保留由服务提供商可以通过调用检索它方法使用一个足够大的缓冲区。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有任何数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到有可用数据。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果您是在非阻止模式下，并且没有在可用的数据中的协议堆栈缓冲区方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 可以使用属性来确定数据是否可供读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议，你可以使用面向连接的协议也。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果你选择这样做，则必须首先可以建立远程主机连接通过调用方法，或接受传入的远程主机连接，通过调用方法。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果没有建立或接受连接，然后调用方法时，将获取。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 您还可以建立默认远程主机之前调用的无连接协议方法。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这些情况下，任一方法将忽略`remoteEP`参数和仅接收来自连接的数据或默认远程主机。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 使用面向连接的套接字将读取的数据，可最多指定的字节量`size`参数。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the amount of bytes specified by the `size` parameter. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到了方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been Received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 然后再调用，则必须显式将绑定到本地终结点使用方法。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 如果不，这样做将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用必须与匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例从远程主机接收无连接的数据报。The following code example receives a connectionless datagram from a remote host. 偏移量、 缓冲区大小，并传递给方法。The offset, buffer size, and are passed to the method. [!code-cpp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#12](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#12)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#12)] [!code-vb[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#12)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法主要用于在无连接的套接字上接收数据。The method is used primarily to receive data on a connectionless socket. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 调用方必须设置属性设置为，数据将从其接收的远程主机。The caller must set the property to the of the remote host from which the data is to be received. 属性上的`e`参数提供了关于读取请求的其他信息的窗口套接字服务提供程序。The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 下列属性和事件上的成功调用此方法所需的对象：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - - - - - 调用方可能会设置属性设置为在调用之前所需的任何用户状态对象方法，以便可在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于面向消息的套接字，传入的消息会放入缓冲区中直到缓冲区的总大小。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer. 和属性确定在缓冲区中数据的放置位置和数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data. 对于字节流样式套接字，传入的数据被放入缓冲区中直到填充缓冲区，连接将关闭，或用完内部缓冲的数据。For byte stream–style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 和属性确定在缓冲区中数据的放置位置和数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数，返回已成功读取的字节数和捕获从其发送数据，以及有关接收到的数据包的信息的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent, as well as information about the received packet. 方法主要用于接收无连接的套接字上的消息数据。The method is used primarily to receive message data on a connectionless socket. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 此方法仅可用于数据报和原始套接字。This method can only be used with datagram and raw sockets. 必须使用套接字类型设置为初始化套接字或之前调用此方法。The socket must be initialized with the socket type set to or before calling this method. 这可以使用构造套接字时。This can be done when the socket is constructed using . 对于面向消息的套接字，传入的消息放入`buffer`最大总大小中指定的参数`size`参数。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the `buffer` parameter up to the total size specified in the `size` parameter. `offset`参数确定在何处`buffer`放置数据。The `offset` parameter determines where in the `buffer` the data is placed. 实际的数据量放入`buffer`返回的方法。The actual amount of data placed into the `buffer` is returned by the method. 方法会自动方法设置套接字选项`true`第一次调用时为给定。The method automatically method sets the socket option to `true` the first time it is called for a given . 但是，返回对象只能是有效的数据包到达本地计算机后已设置的套接字选项。However, the returned object will only be valid for packets which arrive at the local computer after the socket option has been set. 如果套接字在绑定到的本地终结点发送之间的数据包 (显式方法或由其中一个隐式， ， ，或方法) 和其第一次调用方法中，调用方法将返回无效这些数据包的对象。If a socket is sent packets between when it is bound to a local endpoint (explicitly by the method or implicitly by one of the , , , or methods) and its first call to the method, calls to method will return invalid objects for these packets. 若要确保所有对象都有效，应用程序应设置套接字选项`true`绑定到本地终结点使用之前方法。To ensure that all objects are valid, an application should set the socket option to `true` before it is bound to a local endpoint using the method. 应用程序可以检查`ipPacketInformation`参数，如果它需要知道是否使用单播、 多播或广播地址发送数据报。An application can examine the `ipPacketInformation` parameter if it needs to know if the datagram was sent using a unicast, multicast, or broadcast address. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用必须与匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果使用面向连接的协议属性获取，其中包含到的远程 IP 地址和端口号连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the property gets the that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the is connected. 如果使用的是无连接协议包含的默认远程 IP 地址和端口号与将通信。If you are using a connectionless protocol, contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the will communicate. 您必须将此对象转换到之前检索的任何信息。You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. 然后，可以调用方法来检索远程，和方法来检索远程端口号。You can then call the method to retrieve the remote , and the method to retrieve the remote port number. 会在调用后设置或。The is set after a call to either or . 如果你尝试访问更早版本，此属性将引发。If you try to access this property earlier, will throw a . 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索并显示本地和远程终结点。The following code example retrieves and displays the local and remote endpoints. summary.span: 确定一个或多个套接字的状态。

span.span: Determines the status of one or more sockets.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是确定的一个或多个状态的静态方法实例。 is a static method that determines the status of one or more instances. 必须将放置到一个或多个套接字可以使用之前方法。You must place one or more sockets into an before you can use the method. 通过调用检查可读性与作为`checkRead`参数。Check for readability by calling with the as the `checkRead` parameter. 若要检查的可写性套接字，使用`checkWrite`参数。To check your sockets for writability, use the `checkWrite` parameter. 检测错误条件，请使用`checkError`。For detecting error conditions, use `checkError`. 在调用，则会填充使用满足条件这些套接字。After calling , the will be filled with only those sockets that satisfy the conditions. 如果您在侦听状态，可读性意味着调用而不会阻止将会成功。If you are in a listening state, readability means that a call to will succeed without blocking. 如果已接受连接，可读性意味着数据可供读取。If you have already accepted the connection, readability means that data is available for reading. 在这些情况下，所有接收操作而不会阻止将会成功。In these cases, all receive operations will succeed without blocking. 可读性也可指示是否在远程已关闭连接; 在这种情况下调用会立即返回，返回零字节。Readability can also indicate whether the remote has shut down the connection; in that case a call to will return immediately, with zero bytes returned. 返回时至少一个感兴趣的套接字 (在套接字`checkRead`， `checkWrite`，并`checkError`列出了) 满足指定的条件时，或`microSeconds`超过参数，具体取决于第一个。 returns when at least one of the sockets of interest (the sockets in the `checkRead`, `checkWrite`, and `checkError` lists) meets its specified criteria, or the `microSeconds` parameter is exceeded, whichever comes first. 设置`microSeconds`为-1 指定无限期超时。Setting `microSeconds` to -1 specifies an infinite time-out. 如果进行到非阻止调用，可写性表示您已成功连接。If you make a nonblocking call to , writability means that you have connected successfully. 如果已建立的连接，可写性意味着所有发送操作都将成功而不会阻塞。If you already have a connection established, writability means that all send operations will succeed without blocking. 如果您已到非阻止调用，则`checkerror`参数标识未成功连接的套接字。If you have made a non-blocking call to , the `checkerror` parameter identifies sockets that have not connected successfully. > [!NOTE] > 使用方法，如果只想要确定的单个状态。Use the method if you only want to determine the status of a single . > [!NOTE] > 此方法无法检测到某些类型的连接问题，例如断开的网络电缆，或远程主机意外关闭。This method cannot detect certain kinds of connection problems, such as a broken network cable, or that the remote host was shut down ungracefully. 您必须尝试发送或接收数据，以检测这些类型的错误。You must attempt to send or receive data to detect these kinds of errors. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用来确定哪些侦听套接字已连接请求。The following code example uses to determine which listening sockets have a connection request. [!code-cpp[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以同步方式将数据发送到远程主机中指定或方法，并返回已成功发送的字节数。 synchronously sends data to the remote host specified in the or method and returns the number of bytes successfully sent. 可用于面向连接的和无连接协议。 can be used for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols. 此重载需要包含想要发送的数据的缓冲区。This overload requires a buffer that contains the data you want to send. 值将默认为 0，缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，并要将默认值发送到缓冲区的大小的字节数。The value defaults to 0, the buffer offset defaults to 0, and the number of bytes to send defaults to the size of the buffer. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接，或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果使用无连接协议，并且打算将数据发送到多个不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use the method. 如果不使用方法，您将需要致电每次调用前。If you do not use the method, you will have to call before each call to . 可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 您还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用到另一个调用，从而。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到所有缓冲区中的字节都将发送，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在阻止模式下，可能成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序将字节发送缓冲区中。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the bytes in the buffer. 此外，还有您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 发送的成功完成并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果任何缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据在传输系统中不不可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何在连接上的发送数据。The following code example demonstrates sending data on a connected . [!code-cpp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Socket_Sync_Send_Receive#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Sync_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#1)]

a bitwise combination of . 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，并要将默认值发送到缓冲区的大小的字节数。The buffer offset defaults to 0, and the number of bytes to send defaults to the size of the buffer. 如果指定标记为`socketflags`参数值，则不会将路由发送的数据。If you specify the flag as the `socketflags` parameter value, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接，或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to . 您还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用到另一个调用，从而。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到所有缓冲区中的字节都将发送，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在阻止模式下，可能成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序发送请求的字节数。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the requested number of bytes. 此外，还有您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何在连接上的发送数据。The following code example demonstrates sending data on a connected . remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载需要至少一个缓冲区，其中包含你想要发送的数据。This overload requires at least one buffer that contains the data you want to send. 默认值为 0。The value defaults to 0. 如果指定标记为`socketFlags`参数，不会将路由发送的数据。If you specify the flag as the `socketFlags` parameter, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接，或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果使用无连接协议，并且打算将数据发送到多个不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use the method. 如果不使用方法，您将需要致电每次调用前。If you do not use the method, you will have to call before each call to . 可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 您还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用到另一个调用，从而。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到所有缓冲区中的字节都将发送，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在非阻止模式下，可能成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In non-blocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序将字节发送缓冲区中。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the bytes in the buffer. 此外，还有您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 发送的成功完成并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果任何缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据在传输系统中不不可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

number of bytes you want to send, and a bitwise combination of any . 如果指定标记为`socketflags`参数，不会将路由发送的数据。If you specify the flag as the `socketflags` parameter, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接，或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果使用无连接协议，并且打算将数据发送到多个不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless method. 可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 您还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用到另一个调用，从而。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到发送请求的字节数，除非使用设置超时。With a connection-oriented protocol, will block until the requested number of bytes are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在阻止模式下，可能成功完成，即使它发送的请求的字节数小于。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes you request. 它是应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序发送请求的字节数。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the requested number of room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 您必须确保大小不超过基础服务提供程序的最大数据包大小。You must ensure that the size does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，将不发送数据报并将引发。If it does, the datagram will not be sent and will throw a . 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API remarks.format: ## Remarks 以同步方式将数据发送到远程主机中指定或方法，并返回已成功发送的字节数。 synchronously sends data to the remote host specified in the or method and returns the number of bytes successfully sent. 可用于面向连接的和无连接协议。 can be used for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols. 在此重载中，如果您指定标记为`socketflags`参数，不会将路由发送的数据。In this overload, if you specify the flag as the `socketflags` parameter, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method or will throw a . 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接，或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果使用无连接协议，并且打算将数据发送到多个不同的主机，则应使用。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use . 如果不使用，您将需要致电每次调用前。If you do not use , you will have to call before each call to . 可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。It is okay to use even after you have established a default remote host with . 您还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用到另一个调用，从而。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 您还必须确保大小不超过基础服务提供程序的最大数据包大小。You must also be sure that the size does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，将不发送数据报并将引发。If it does, the datagram will not be sent and will throw a . 如果使用面向连接的协议会阻塞，直到发送请求的字节数，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until the requested number of bytes are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超过超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在阻止模式下，可能成功完成，即使它发送的请求的字节数小于。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes you request. 它是应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序发送请求的字节数。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the requested number of bytes. 此外，还有您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 发送的成功完成并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果任何缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据在传输系统中不不可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于从面向连接的套接字上的一个或多个缓冲区写入传出数据。The method is used to write outgoing data from one or more buffers on a connection-oriented socket. 此方法也可用，但是，已对连接操作指定远程主机的无连接套接字上。This method can also be used, however, on connectionless sockets that have specified a remote host on a connect operation. 方法启动异步发送操作中建立的远程主机， ， ， ， ，或方法。The method starts an asynchronous send operation to the remote host established in the , , , , , or method. 下列属性和事件上的成功调用此方法所需的对象：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - 或 or - 如果设置 if is set - 如果设置 if is set - 调用方可能会设置属性设置为在调用之前所需的任何用户状态对象方法，以便可在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 方法将引发异常，如果不首先调用， ， ， ，或。The method will throw an exception if you do not first call , , , , or . 调用方法使你能够发送单独的执行线程中的数据。Calling the method gives you the ability to send data within a separate execution thread. 对于面向消息的套接字，不超过基础 Windows 套接字服务提供程序的最大消息大小。For message-oriented sockets, do not exceed the maximum message size of the underlying Windows sockets service provider. 如果数据太长，以原子方式通过基础服务提供商，传输任何数据并方法会抛出与设置为本机 Winsock WSAEMSGSIZE 错误代码 (10040)。If the data is too long to pass atomically through the underlying service provider, no data is transmitted and the method throws a with the set to the native Winsock WSAEMSGSIZE error code (10040). 请注意，成功完成方法并不表示数据已成功传递。Note that the successful completion of the method does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载将该文件发送`fileName`到连接的套接字。This overload sends the file `fileName` to the connected socket. `flags`参数默认为(0)，并`preBuffer`并`postBuffer`参数默认为`null`。The `flags` parameter defaults to (0), and the `preBuffer` and `postBuffer` parameters default to `null`. 如果`fileName`是在本地目录中，它可能会标识只是该文件的名称; 否则，必须指定完整路径和文件的名称。If `fileName` is in the local directory, it may be identified with just the name of the file; otherwise, the full path and name of the file must be specified. 通配符 ("...\\\myfile.txt") 和 UNC 共享名 ("\\\\\\\shared directory\\\myfile.txt") 支持。Wildcards ("..\\\myfile.txt") and UNC share names ("\\\\\\\shared directory\\\myfile.txt") are supported. 如果未找到文件，该异常引发。If the file is not found, the exception is thrown. 此方法使用`TransmitFile`Windows Sockets 2 API 中找到函数。This method uses the `TransmitFile` function found in the Windows Sockets 2 API. 有关详细信息`TransmitFile`函数和它的标志，请参阅 MSDN 库中的 Windows 套接字文档。For more information about the `TransmitFile` function and its flags, see the Windows Sockets documentation in the MSDN Library. 以同步方式将文件发送到远程主机中指定或方法。 synchronously sends a file to the remote host specified in the or method. 可以使用面向连接的两个和无连接协议。 can be used for both connection-oriented and for connectionless protocols. 如果您使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法，否则引发异常。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, otherwise throws a exception. 如果使用的是面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果使用面向连接的协议阻止，直到该文件发送。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, blocks until the file is sent. 在阻止模式下，发送整个文件之前，可能会成功完成。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully before the entire file has been sent. 则您发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成方法意味着的基础系统已为你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区的空间。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档在 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建并连接套接字，然后将文件发送到远程主机。The following code example creates and connects a socket and then sends a file to the remote host. 文件"test.txt"位于本地计算机的根目录中。The file "test.txt" is located in the root directory of the local machine.
